result.execSummary:
The defendant Victoria J Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Ms. Ward to pay court costs= $484.50 to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 3/8/16 and on the 8th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

0 days credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Victoria J Ward

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: to Defendant (No Surety listed on Bond).
16A 030154   VOIDED
Criminal Case Settlement
with Elements attached

Case called at 1:09pm [mo]
Defendant Victoria J Ward in court with Attorney Teri Strohschein.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
 
ADA Hall orally motions to amend Count #2 of the Complaint to strike 'syringes' in the charging language of the Criminal Complaint and insert the listing of other various drug paraphernalia as listed in the factual portion of the Complaint
--no objection from Atty. Strohschein
--the Court grants the Motion to Amend the Criminal Complaint
 
The Court finds that the Defendant is a repeater

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of " Guilty " entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

The Court sentences Ms. Ward to pay court costs= $484.50 to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 3/8/16 and on the 8th day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 30 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.

0 days credit
recess: 1:43pm
Plea/sentencing hearing at 02-08-2016 01:15 pm

Case called at 11:26am [mo]
Defendant Victoria J Ward not in court.  Attorney Teri Stroschein does not appear. 
Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

The Court indicates that a proposed stipulation for continuance was submitted to the Court; the Court took this stipulation under advisement.
The Court's JA did not receive notification from Atty. Stroschein as to whether she would have other court obligations.
The Court and ADA Hall take the position that Atty. Stroschein informed Ms. Ward she did not need to appear at todays hearing.
Atty. Stroschein is to contact the Court's JA to schedule a Plea/Sentencing; Atty. Stroschein is to contact the Court's JA within the next 10 days
recess: 11:33am
Request for continuance is under advisement until 1-11-16
Proposed stip and order for continuance
State's with Cover Letter
Status conference at 01-12-2016 10:00 am
Pre-trial conference at 12-02-2015 10:00 am

Scheduling Notice

Case called at 10:00am [mo]
Defendant Victoria J Ward in court with Attorney Teri M. Strohschein.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Court finds there is Chapter 950 compliance

The Court reviews the Court Record

Defendant verifies that the date of birth on the Criminal Complaint is correct
The Defendant provides an updated address
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court maintains the $500 CASH bond, it adds the conditions:
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernailia, to include needles and syringes unless deemed medically necessary
--No Contact with Cassidy Conell
recess: 10:05am

NEW DATE/TIME FOR APPEARANCE MUST BE GIVEN BEFORE RELEASE

Case called at 2:07 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for initial appearance)
Defendant Victoria J Ward not in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall informs the Court that summons sent to Walworth Co. Jail came back as undeliverable, so do believe she is no longer there. Request probable cause warrant
Court finds probable cause within the complaint, orders issuance of arrest warrant - Defendant may post $500 cash as long as nerw date/time for appearance is given before release
Recess: 2:11 pm
